body.p:
Frankfort Ky Oct 28-1863
To His Excellency
Gov. Bramlette:

Your petitioner Eli McDaniel pray you to remit a fine of ten dollars imposed upon him by the City Court of Frankfort Ky. about the 3rd or 4th day of Sept. 1863, for committing a breach of the peace as was formed in the juries verdict, by drawing a pistol upon one Rev. T. W. Moore who had attacked his person by throwing stones at him. He states that he committed no such breach of the peace, he not being the attacking party, nor did he so intend. He further states that he has a family to provide for and is little able to do so, being poor and often without labor to perform. He also subjoins to this his petition, the approval of many worthy citizens of the city of Frankfort, as being just and who are willing that he should be relieved of the said fine.

With due regard he is your humble servant
E W McDaniel
We the undersigned willilgly approve the above petition of Eli McDaniel and recommend the Governor to remit the said fine.

Very respectfully
D. G. Venable
J. C. Hendricks
Robt Gillson, Juryman
John. J. Quin
William. T. Bacon
Elias Stone
John Whitehead Juriman
Henry J Meets
James S. Duvall

Tho E Bramlette
